titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edgar Saltus Papers
titlestmt.author: by Michael L. Forstrom

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:30

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Edgar Saltus papers contain writings, correspondence, and other materials documenting the life of American author Edgar Saltus.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Edgar Saltus Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edgar Saltus Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Preliminary processing was done to the Edgar Saltus papers at an unknown date. During reprocessing of the collection in 2010, material relating to Saltus that had been donated to the library by sources other than his daughter, Elsie Saltus Munds, and added to the Saltus papers, was removed from the collection. Otherwise, the arrangement of writings and correspondence was largely preserved in Series I and II, and other materials were consolidated in Series III.

bioghist.head: Edgar Saltus (1855-1921)
bioghist.p: Edgar Saltus was a novelist, essayist, and poet. He attended St. Paul's School in Concord, New Hampshire and Yale College in 1876 and 1877, before studying abroad and receiving the degree of LL.B. from Columbia College in 1880, though he never practiced law. Saltus was married three times: to Helen Sturgis Read in November 1883, to Elsie Welch Smith on October 8, 1895, and to author Marie Florence Giles on August 16, 1911. There is considerable scholarship on Saltus, including book-length biographical studies by Marie Saltus (1925) and Claire Sprague (1968). Summary information is available in the standard biographical resources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Edgar Saltus papers contain writings, correspondence, and other materials documenting the life and work of author Edgar Saltus. Writings consist chiefly of drafts, some heavily corrected, for shorter works such as poems, stories, and essays, but include substantive drafts for the novels The Ghost Girl (1922) and The Paliser Case (1919) and other longer works. Correspondence consists of a small number of letters between Saltus and family members, publishers, editors, and other writers, most notably James Huneker and Richard Le Gallienne, and British actor Henry Irving. Other materials include three scrapbooks containing clippings, with reviews and writings, printed ephemera, photographs, and correspondence relating to Saltus, his family, and his third wife, author Marie Florence Giles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Writings, 1884-1919. II. Correspondence, 1888-1925. Other Materials, 1889-1926.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title or supplied heading.

Series I, Writings, consists of drafts for shorter works, such as poems, stories, and essays, and for novels, The Ghost Girl (1922) and The Paliser Case (1919), and other longer works. Most drafts are hand-written (holograph) and signed, and some are heavily corrected. In addition to the genre, the presence of multiple drafts and other physical formats (typescript or clippings) is noted in folder headings below. A small number of notebooks are filed by title.
Additional short writings can be found among the clippings in scrapbooks in Series III. Other Materials.

"The Wager," story, drafts, holograph and typescript carbon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Correspondence, contains a small number of letters between Edgar Saltus and family members, publishers, editors, and other writers, most notably James Huneker and Richard Le Gallienne, and British actor Henry Irving. Additional correspondence to Saltus and his wife Marie Florence Giles can be found in the scrapbooks in Series III. Other Materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III, Other Materials, contains a single manuscript fragment, photograph of Edgar Fawcett, will, and three scrapbooks. The scrapbooks contain clippings, printed ephemera, photographs, and correspondence. The clippings relate to Saltus, his wife Marie Giles, and family, and include reviews and writings. Writings, for example, include printed versions of poems, short fiction, and essays for such magazines as Harper's Bazaar , as well as a number of short pieces for newspapers dating from 1902 and 1903.
